page.title: 03Attitudes of Silverdale folk
page.content: Although there is no mains sewerage at Jenny Brown's Point and Crag Foot and numbers 1,2,&3 Brown's cottages have no mains water, the residents all feel that the outstanding beauty of the area is compensation, and they are obviously very happy with their environment and particular way of life. Some however are concerned about the nuclear power stations at Heysham and at Sellafield on the Cumbrian coast, particularly pollution of the sea and its effects on the coastline. Also nuclear waste is carried by the railway close by. Others thought their rates were too high in view of the lack of amenities. The lack of a mains gas supply is also a disadvantage. There is no public transport to Jenny Brown's Point nor to Crag Foot so car ownership or love of walking is essential.
